body:
For a more lengthy difference sample, I submit my [Write-MeditationPrompt](https://github.com/vexx32/PSKoans/blob/master/PSKoans/Private/Write-MeditationPrompt.ps1) function from PSKoans.

Without this change, I have to keep my here-strings in a hashtable to contain the chaos:
```powershell
    #region Prompt Text
    $Prompts = @{
        Welcome        = @"
    Welcome, seeker of enlightenment.
    Please wait a moment while we examine your karma...
"@
        Describe       = @"
Describing '$DescribeName' has damaged your karma.
"@
        TestFailed     = @"
    You have not yet reached enlightenment.
    The answers you seek...
"@
        Expectation    = $Expectation
        Meditate       = @"
    Please meditate on the following code:
"@
        Subject        = @"
[It] $ItName
$Meditation
"@
        Wisdom         = @"
    $($Koan -replace "`n","`n    ")
    Your path thus far:
"@
        OpenFolder     = @"
You may run 'Measure-Karma -Meditate' to begin your meditation.
"@
        Completed      = @"
    Congratulations! You have taken the first steps towards enlightenment.
    You cast your gaze back upon the path that you have walked:
"@
        BookSuggestion = @"
    If you would like to further your studies in this manner, consider investing in
    'PowerShell by Mistake' by Don Jones - https://leanpub.com/powershell-by-mistake
"@
    }
    #endregion Prompt Text
```

Although, granted, the reason this screws with indentation so much is because here-strings take all things, even whitespace, literally. ðŸ˜• 

It's handy to be able to do in cases like this, but... simple things like this suggestion might make them more workable, perhaps?
